article.headline: Davidson 120, Emory 56
article.story: DAVIDSON, N.C. (AP) -- Stephen Curry's 27 points led five Davidson players in double figures in the Wildcats' 120-56 season-opening win over Emory on Friday night. Curry hit 10-of-15 from the floor, including five 3-pointers, reaching the 20-point level for the 20th time in his career. Jason Richards had 14 points and 10 assists, while Boris Meno had 12 points and 13 rebounds for Davidson (1-0). Bryant Barr scored 17 off the bench including five 3-pointers, and Brendan McKillop had 11 in his collegiate debut. Dan Curtin's 11 points made him the lone player in double figures for Emory (0-1), which shot just 30.6 overall. The Wildcats scored the games first 16 points and held a 65-45 lead at the half. The team's points total was the most for a Davidson club since the Wildcats defeated Washington & Jefferson 125-44 on Dec. 21, 2002.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
